overview_of_class: "Recitative for the Conductor" is designed to familiarize conducting students with the performance practice and conducting techniques that pertain to secco and accompagnatorecitatives of the 17th, 18th, and 19th centuries. Knowledge and skill in regards to recitative is of tremendous importance to conductors performing operas, oratorios and cantatas from these time periods. Through the consultation of historical statements and writings, students will explore the performance practice of secco recitatives. The primary activity for students will be conducting accompagnato recitatives from the works of Monteverdi, Bach, Handel, Haydn, Mozart Beethoven, Mendelssohn, and other composers.
name: Selected Topics
subject: CONDUCT
